io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.spi

Interface HttpClientSupport


  • @ConsumerType
public interface HttpClientSupport
    A simpler callback-style SPI interface that you can implement instead of HalResourceLoader if you want to enable Rhyme or HalApiClient instances to fetch HTTP resources with a custom client library. You can then use HalResourceLoaderBuilder.withCustomHttpClient(HttpClientSupport) to build to HalResourceLoader that uses your implementation, and adds the additional response parsing and error handling.
    See Also:
    HalResourceLoader, HalResourceLoaderBuilder, HttpUrlConnectionSupport

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void executeGetRequest(URI uri, HttpClientCallback callback)
      Starts executing a HTTP GET request for the given URL (either synchronously or asynchronously) and calls the call the following methods *once* in this order: HttpClientCallback.onUrlModified(URI) (optional) HttpClientCallback.onHeadersAvailable(int, java.util.Map) (required) HttpClientCallback.onBodyAvailable(java.io.InputStream) (required) If any exception is thrown that prevents starting or completing the request, you must call HttpClientCallback.onExceptionCaught(Throwable) once (and do not call any further methods).

    • Method Detail

      • executeGetRequest

        void executeGetRequest(URI uri,
                       HttpClientCallback callback)
        Starts executing a HTTP GET request for the given URL (either synchronously or asynchronously) and calls the call the following methods *once* in this order:
        • HttpClientCallback.onUrlModified(URI) (optional)
        • HttpClientCallback.onHeadersAvailable(int, java.util.Map) (required)
        • HttpClientCallback.onBodyAvailable(java.io.InputStream) (required)
        If any exception is thrown that prevents starting or completing the request, you must call HttpClientCallback.onExceptionCaught(Throwable) once (and do not call any further methods).
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the resource to load. This is usually a fully qualified HTTP(S) URL,but it could be any URI (depending on how the entry point was loaded and which kind of links are represented in the upstream resources)
        callback - that handles the response when it is available
